Key Arguments: The legislation threatens democracy by restricting free speech.
Free speech should not be limited by government bodies.
Public debate is the best way to combat misinformation and disinformation.
The terms 'misinformation', 'disinformation', and 'serious harm' are poorly defined and open to abuse.
The bill contravenes Article 19 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR), which protects freedom of expression.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is an all-or-nothing concept; there are no gradations where it can be slightly limited.
The most effective way to combat misinformation or disinformation is through public debate.
This draft Bill signals a dangerous turn toward totalitarianism. It is akin to the creation of a 'Ministry of Truth' as per George Orwellâ€™s '1984'.
